New Records: New York are the first team since 1970 to extend a World Series to a fifth game when down three games to none.
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe hits a grand slam against the Dodgers in the third inning.
Torres hits a three-run home run in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Austin Wells hits a home run in the bottom of the sixth inning.
Judge gets an RBI hit and steals second in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Verdugo hits a ground ball allowing Volpe to score in the bottom of the eighth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers aimed to get through a bullpen game without using their big bullpen pieces, keeping them fresh for Game 5.
New York will have their ace Gerrit Cole on the hill for Game 5, while the Dodgers will have Jack Flaherty.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees stave off elimination with a Game 4 win, bringing pride to the Bronx.
The Dodgers' goal was to save their key relievers for Game 5, which they achieved.
Miscellaneous Highlights: A fan was ejected for prying a ball out of Mookie Betts’ glove.
